thread.title_full: Massive Dust Storm Hits Delhi-NCR, IMD Asks People To ‚ÄòStay Indoors‚Äô. Visuals Surface

author: ABP News Bureau
title: Massive Dust Storm Hits Delhi-NCR, IMD Asks People To ‚ÄòStay Indoors‚Äô. Visuals Surface
text: The weather department had predicted that Delhi residents may enjoy relief from the heat as light drizzles and thunderstorms were forecasted for May 11 and 12. Delhi, NCR experienced a major dust storm on Friday evening, providing relief from scorching temperatures. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), rain was predicted for the national capital for this week, while the maximum temperature in the region soared to 42 degrees Celcius. On Tuesday, Delhi recorded its highest temperature of the season, three notches above the normal. In an X post, IMD issued warnings for the national capital and its adjoining area. The weather department has urged residents to stay indoors. Check out the post here: ‚Äî India Meteorological Department (@Indiametdept) [#Impact]expected over Delhi-NCR & adjoining areas due to duststorm: ‚û¢ Strong winds may damage plantation, horticulture and standing crops. ‚û¢ Partial damage to vulnerable structures due to strong winds. Minor damage to kutcha houses/walls and huts. ‚û¢ Loose objects may fly. [May 10, 2024] ‚Äî India Meteorological Department (@Indiametdept) [#Duststorm]/ [#thunderstorm]with rain (followed by rain) and gusty winds with speed of 50-70 Km/h would occur over and adjoining areas of entire Delhi and NCR (Loni Dehat, Hindon AF Station, Ghaziabad, Indirapuram, Chhapraula, Noida, Dadri, Greater Noida, Gurugram, Faridabad, [pic.twitter.com/xufJKmMdt8] [May 10, 2024] Visuals Surface On Social Media What‚Äôs going on in Noida?‚Äî Best Technicals (@BestTechnicals) [pic.twitter.com/Ns6RiTmbmx] [May 10, 2024] Very heavy storm in Noida‚Äî Rajeev Prajapati (@rajeevocs) [#Storm] [#Noida] [#Nature] [#ArvindKejriwal] [pic.twitter.com/eLuJqVJkk5] [May 10, 2024] India greater Noida üí®üí®üí®üå™Ô∏èüå™Ô∏è‚Äî Ashrafi M91 (@M91Ashrafi58743) [pic.twitter.com/JftmEBKsCW] [May 10, 2024] The weather has suddenly changed in Delhi. Dust storm, thunderstorm and Strong winds are blowing in many areas of Delhi. Be careful and be safe üëç‚Äî AviüçÅ (@avitrends) [#delhi]| weather | delhi weather | [#thunderstorm] [pic.twitter.com/7V5XUAHqQf] [May 10, 2024] ‚Äî Niharika MaheshwariüáÆüá≥ (@niharikam_21) [#WeatherUpdate] [#Delhi] [#noida] [#BreakingNews] [#weathernews] [pic.twitter.com/JJaskw0ch3] [May 10, 2024] The weather department had predicted that Delhi residents may enjoy relief from the heat as light drizzles and thunderstorms were forecasted for May 11 and 12. During the second week of May last year, Delhi experienced a high of 42 degrees Celcius, although no heatwaves were recorded. The weather department previously stated that there would be no heatwave conditions in the capital for at least 10 days. However, a heatwave alert may be issued towards the end of May due to rising temperatures. Delhi gears up for the Lok Sabha elections 2024 in the sixth phase on May 25.
